website_summaries.verdict: Flexible and lightweight downhill poles that perform well on the slopes.
pros: If you're looking for a lightweight pair of poles that will last you for years, this is your best option
These Lollipop poles have graphite carbon composite shafts that reduce vibration and flex easily
Customers love the comfortable grips and balance
Available in a range of colors
cons: There are less expensive options available, but otherwise these are excellent poles

customer_reviews.title: Perfect grips
customer_reviews.text: A ski pole is a ski pole, until you look at small details. One, carbon fiber poles have a smaller chance of being broken or bent in airline luggage handling. Two, the grip is shaped to prevent a gloved hand from slipping down around the pole during an aggressive pole plant. Three, the strap adjustment is part of the top part of the grip, so there are no plastic buckles flying around to smack you in the event of an errant pole plant in large bumps. Great ski pole.
customer_reviews.author: George T Foster

customer_reviews.title: Good pole., Light Weight
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy using these poles, very light weight and durable. I used them on my first ski trip, mind you I was a snowboarder for 20 years. I learned to ski in around twenty minutes. The poles were a good height, and the strap held up well on the first five trips I did. The strap released well from my hand on a fall I had, which was on my second trip, and it made me more comfortable with the poles, for safety. I hope they last for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: S.S.

customer_reviews.title: Solid performer
customer_reviews.text: Great poles, just bought, used all week up in Vermont skiing, been skiing 30+ yrs.... solid choice I'm 6'0" and went with the 50" -(127cm) poles, perfect
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: light weight but sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I bought these poles because I had been using the same poles for 20 years. these are so much lighter and the grips are great. the price really cant be beat. I saw similar poles at local ski shop that were $30 more. just make sure you buy the correct size.
customer_reviews.author: Swishopper

customer_reviews.title: Very bad straps attachment to week ...
customer_reviews.text: Straps are falling apart ... In the middle of the ride I lost the pole because of straps detached from the pole .. First I put them together and not to long after I lost the pole on the lift chair ... After a 45 minutes I finally foud the pole with untight straps and the little peace is missing ... For 75 bucks it should be much better poles .. These ones are not worth a penny .... So disappointed... ....
customer_reviews.author: Reborn-NY

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but pretty thin...
customer_reviews.text: Looks like a good pole.. the straps were twisted but I was able to fix that. They are pretty thin poles, but I guess the fact that they are Graphite will keep them from breaking. I think that is the style now? The graphics are pretty cool.
customer_reviews.author: roman

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Poles for the Price
customer_reviews.text: You could spend over $100 on poles, but there's no need to. These are sturdy, lightweight and stylish. Many colors to choose from. I've been satisfied with their performance this ski season (well, it's over now).
customer_reviews.author: bigeugene

customer_reviews.title: Light weight good looking poles
customer_reviews.text: These poles are great...light weight compared to my old poles and are holding up well. Good value for money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great straps
customer_reviews.text: The best thing about these poles is how easy it is to adjust the straps. I have a tendency of hanging my hands on the straps while I'm waiting around for the lift. My last set of poles broke this way. However, since the straps are held in differently I haven't had any issues. Overall, very good poles and great bang for your buck¡
customer_reviews.author: Lucy

customer_reviews.title: Love these Ski Poles
customer_reviews.text: Skied with my new poles and really liked how light they were. I had been using very old and outdated poles so these are excellent!
customer_reviews.author: JLA

customer_reviews.title: Well balanced.
customer_reviews.text: These poles were a gift for my Son-in-law. He loves them. He commented they are well balanced and feel very natural. They are light in weight and slim. The contour of the handles provide a good fit to his hands. Based on his feedback, I purchased another set for my daughter.
customer_reviews.author: T Riggs

customer_reviews.title: Don’t miss out!
customer_reviews.text: Poles are great and very durable, a couple hard yard sales and virtually no damage to the poles at all!
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with hand guards
customer_reviews.text: We purchased these poles and the hand guards of the same name. These poles do not come apart at all to allow installation of the hand guards.
customer_reviews.author: KVBR

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: Had them out in the slopes and they did very well. Light weight and nice looking. My only wish is that the strap loop is a little bigger but this is a personal preference.
customer_reviews.author: WB Martin

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Good quality for a lower price than ski areas charge. Paint chips off easily on the lower pole areas, however
customer_reviews.author: backdoc

customer_reviews.title: If you ski bumps...
customer_reviews.text: For years I've noticed the best bump skiers on the hill using Zipline Poles. Lots of mogul competitors swear by them so I figured I'd give them a shot. These are outstanding poles, lightweight, perfectly balanced and great grips. Love the new colors. I have already recommended these poles to many of my friends. THINK SNOW!!
customer_reviews.author: Bumpin' Time

customer_reviews.title: Solid looking pole...  Thin, light enough, and appear durable
customer_reviews.text: Very nice looking... I like the black bottoms. They will hide scratches from skis well... I ordered powder baskets, but the ones that come on it look fine.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Happy skier
customer_reviews.text: My grand daughter loved them and they arrive very quicklu
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Arnold

customer_reviews.title: Great value for a high tech pole.
customer_reviews.text: I like the product, good value and well manufactured. I particularly like the flex characteristics (moderate) and low swing weight. The carbide tip is excellent and protective storage caps are a nice extra. I would prefer a buckle adjustable wrist strap and wider, more robust strap.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: Durability questionable
customer_reviews.text: They did what I needed them to, however i already bent both of them a bit after just 5 days of skiing
customer_reviews.author: Coyotegurl

customer_reviews.title: They are great ski poles
customer_reviews.text: I love these poles they a great on the snow I am a race coach in pa. And they do a great job for me
customer_reviews.author: ace

customer_reviews.title: Great color & lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Great poles, got red and looks great with my skis, easy to find, light and seem durable
customer_reviews.author: Marci

customer_reviews.title: Very sharp and light, but too flexible.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice, but too flexible for me. Next time I will buy aluminum.
customer_reviews.author: ScotZ71

customer_reviews.title: what a beautiful color! I am so excited to bring these ...
customer_reviews.text: First off, what a beautiful color! I am so excited to bring these out on the slopes. They are super light, but also very durable with a nice swing weight! I have the white zipline graphite poles too and wanted another color! 10/10 would recommend if you are looking for a pole, this is the one for you with many different color options!
customer_reviews.author: David C. Shimko

customer_reviews.title: Best Poles Out There!
customer_reviews.text: As this is my first time ordering Zipline ski poles, I am very pleased. It is without a doubt the lightest pole I have skied with, and very sturdy. They are also very comfortable in your hand having a excellent grip, so it's easy to get a firm grasp of. Everything about this pole exceeded my expectations. Plus, they can't miss ya with the color schemes! I recommend these for any discipline of skiing. All around great pole.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Soooooooo light, you don't even realize youre carrying poles ...
customer_reviews.text: Soooooooo light, you don't even realize youre carrying poles. I've had other graphites, they are a must have for the ski enthuiast
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Algiere

customer_reviews.title: Worked great, size and color as advertised
customer_reviews.text: used them on Whisler. Worked great, size and color as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: David King

customer_reviews.title: They are very lite with nice grips and easy to adjust straps
customer_reviews.text: I made it up to the mountain yester and tried out these new poles. They are very lite with nice grips and easy to adjust straps. They have a beautiful finish on them and it did not scratch or chip. These are the best poles that I have ever owned!
customer_reviews.author: Jerry C.

customer_reviews.title: Good Poles. as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Poles arrived as advertised, lightweight and strong. I have used them twice now and no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice poles, absolutely no regrets on this purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Love the grip style, the strap is a perfect design and the weight versus strength perfectly balanced. 🤙⛷
customer_reviews.author: Shon Ledin

customer_reviews.title: Distinguished Set
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful set crafted in light weight aluminum...a well balanced set of tool.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: great ski pole
customer_reviews.text: great swing weight and the grip in comfortable. hope they are durable as well.
customer_reviews.author: JJP

customer_reviews.title: NIce size and weight
customer_reviews.text: I like the length and the swing weight of the pole.
customer_reviews.author: jane watkins

customer_reviews.title: I do not recommend these poles very poor quality
customer_reviews.text: The swing weight of the pole is heavy-uncomfortable while skiing for pole planting and the finish coating chips off very easily like cheap finger nail polish after only 2 hours of use. I am very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Butch Hiatt

customer_reviews.title: Broken strap
customer_reviews.text: Decent carbon pole for the price. Pole strap broke after first day of using it. Poor design made of plastic. I’m having a hard time figuring out who to contact to replacement.
customer_reviews.author: J. Borkowski

customer_reviews.title: They haven’t broken yet!
customer_reviews.text: They’re definitely nicer than the ones you get when you’re renting. I like them.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Nice Poles at a Good Price
customer_reviews.text: Poles fit as expected and are sturdy and light weight. Good value.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Good poles, not sure about the finish.
customer_reviews.text: Some of the finish has chipped off after 2 weeks of skiing.
customer_reviews.author: TINA P.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy pole
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy pole that will hold up well. The swing weight is heavier than I like but that is a personal preference.
customer_reviews.author: David A. Beckwith

customer_reviews.title: Skiing style matters when selecting a pole
customer_reviews.text: Pole construction is bullet proof. Grips feel secure in hand. Straps are easily adjusted with glove on. I will be ordering shorter poles for my style of skiing.
customer_reviews.author: mike sidelinger

customer_reviews.title: Love the colors & style
customer_reviews.text: Love the colors & style. Arrived on time and fit me perfect. Can't wait to try them on the hill no snow yet ugh.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Potter

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, Reasonable Price
customer_reviews.text: Great product and very well priced for the starving Race Parent -
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You get what u pay for
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to replace my Goode composite poles I have skied with for 35 years. No such luck!
customer_reviews.author: Red Grid

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable handles
customer_reviews.text: Quality poles for the price, similar weight compared to aluminum poles
customer_reviews.author: john

product_meta.title: Ski Poles Graphite Carbon Composite - Zipline Lollipop U.S. Ski Team Official Supplier
feature_bullets: U.S. SKI TEAM OFFICIAL SUPPLIER - Used by the best: Designed for skiers of all abilities, Zipline is the choice of 2018 Olympic Gold Medalist David Wise, and other Olympic and World Cup athletes. The 14.0mm Lollipop poles are more forgiving in flex than the Zipline Podium or Blurr models and were created for the park, pipe, or freeskier. They are super light, have a great feel, and come in a variety of vibrant colors to match your skis.

GRAPHITE CARBON COMPOSITE TECHNOLOGY - Makes them super light & durable: Lightweight graphite-carbon technology replaces the outdated aluminum of most ski poles, resulting in a pole that reduces vibration with every pole plant, is lightweight, and durable to provide effortless swing weight.

“ZIP TOUCH” DUAL DENSITY GRIP - Improved non-slip grip for a better feel: Our signature “trigger finger” ZipGrip is built with thermoplastic (TPU) and contours to your hand, preventing your gloves from slipping.
ZIP STRAPS - Streamlined straps: Easily adjustable on the fly and for the perfect fit with no plastic buckles flying around!
CARBIDE ZIP TIP - Tough and sharp: With teeth, allows for precise pole plants and secured grip - in any condition!
